title: Battery indicator is misleading with two batteries

labels.description: Good first issue to get your feet wet.

body:
## Bug Report

#### Current Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of the behavior. -->
The low battery will say that I have 5% left when one battery is low but the other battery has plenty left. See screenshots below.

#### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->

The battery indicator will only show when the overall charge of multiple batteries is low, not when a single battery is.

#### Additional context/Screenshots
<!-- Add any other context about the problem here. If applicable, add screenshots to help explain. -->

![terminal-output](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1145631/69367378-0d712700-0cfd-11ea-934a-44a8bde34fac.png)
![power-state](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1145631/69367388-1235db00-0cfd-11ea-9939-62bdf488c218.png)

#### Environment
- Starship version: starship 0.26.4
- Shell type: zsh
- Shell version: zsh 5.7.1 (x86_64-pc-linux-gnu)
- Shell plugin manager: zgen
- Terminal emulator:  gnome-terminal
- Operating system: Linux (Arch Linux)

#### Relevant Shell Configuration
<!-- 
  Based on the shell you use, please paste the appropriate configuration.
    Fish users: ~/.config/fish/config.fish
    Zsh users: ~/.zshrc
-->

```bash
zstyle ':prezto:*:*' color 'yes'

## zgen
source $HOME/.zgen/zgen.zsh
if ! zgen saved; then
  zgen prezto

  zgen prezto history-substring-search
  zgen prezto utility

  zgen save
fi

# conditionally run with starship
if command -v starship > /dev/null 2>&1 ; then
  eval "$(starship init zsh)"
else
  prompt pure
fi
```

#### Starship Configuration
<!-- Can be found in $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/starship.toml or  ~/.config/starship.toml -->

I have not have a config file.

#### Possible Solution
<!--- Only if you have suggestions on a fix for the bug -->

* Calculate the "total" battery (`total remaining charge` / `total capacity of all batteries`)
  * This could be done here or as a possible patch to the `battery` crate & used here
* Use the battery with the highest remaining charge for the remaining
